revision.text:
{{pp|small=yes}} {{Use mdy dates|date=December 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Alison Brie | image = Alison Brie by Gage Skidmore 2.jpg | caption = Brie in July 2013 | birth_name = Alison Brie Schermerhorn | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1982|12|29}} | birth_place = [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. | occupation = {{flatlist| *Actress *producer *model}} | alma_mater = [[California Institute of the Arts]] | years_active = 2004–present | spouse = {{Marriage|[[Dave Franco]]|2017}} }} '''Alison Brie Schermerhorn''' (born December 29, 1982) is an American actress, producer, and model.
Brie is best known for her starring role as [[Annie Edison]] in the comedy series ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]'' (2009–2015) and [[Trudy Campbell]] in the drama series ''[[Mad Men]]'' (2007–2015). She also voices Diane Nguyen on the animated series ''[[BoJack Horseman]]'' (2014–present) and portrays Ruth Wilder in the comedy series ''[[GLOW (TV series)|GLOW]]'' (2017–present), for which she received a nomination for the [[Golden Globe Award for Best Actress – Television Series Musical or Comedy]] and the [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Comedy Series]].
In addition to her television work, Brie has starred in films such as ''[[Scream 4]]'' (2011), ''[[The Five-Year Engagement]]'' (2012), ''[[The Lego Movie]]'' (2014), ''[[Get Hard]]'' (2015), ''[[Sleeping with Other People]]'' (2015), ''[[How to Be Single]]'' (2016), ''[[The Little Hours]]'' (2017), ''[[The Disaster Artist (film)|The Disaster Artist]]'' (2017), and ''[[The Post (film)|The Post]]'' (2017).
==Early life== Alison Brie Schermerhorn was born on December 29, 1982,<!--- 1982 is correct ---> in [[Hollywood, California]].<ref>{{cite interview|first=Alison|last=Brie|interviewer=Marc Maron|url=http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episodes/episode_386_-_alison_brie|title=Episode 386 - Alison Brie|website=WTFPod.com|date=May 8, 2013|accessdate=January 17, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Robertson|first1=Josh|title=25 Things You Didn't Know About Alison Brie|url=http://www.complex.com/pop-culture/2013/02/25-things-you-didnt-know-about-alison-brie/alison-brie-clown-named-sunny|accessdate=June 28, 2017|work=[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]|date=February 26, 2013|language=en}}</ref> Her father, Charles Terry Schermerhorn, is a musician and freelance entertainment reporter.<ref name="HC wedding">{{cite web|url=https://lwpolive.heraldchronicle.com/olive/ode/winchester/LandingPage/LandingPage.aspx?href=TFdDLzIwMTAvMTEvMjY.&pageno=MTI.&entity=QXIwMTIwMQ..&view=ZW50aXR5|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140420011759/http://lwpolive.heraldchronicle.com/olive/ode/winchester/LandingPage/LandingPage.aspx?href=TFdDLzIwMTAvMTEvMjY.&pageno=MTI.&entity=QXIwMTIwMQ..&view=ZW50aXR5|dead-url=yes|archive-date=April 20, 2014|title=Schermerhorn, Brandenstein Wed In Summer Ceremony|website=HeraldChronicle.com}}</ref><ref name=PWeekly>{{cite news|url=http://www.pasadenaweekly.com/cms/story/detail/a_shooting_star/7555|title=A Shooting star Alison Brie is one of the busiest young actresses in Hollywood...|date=August 1, 2009|website=[[Pasadena Weekly]]|first=Carl|last=Kozlowski|accessdate=January 17, 2016}}</ref> Her mother, Joanne Brenner, works at Para los Niños ("For the Children"), a non-profit childcare agency.<ref>[http://www.cmfa-ca.com/resources/CMFA%20Board%20Package%201%2011%2013.pdf Staff Reports], California Municipal Finance Authority</ref> She has an older sister named Lauren.<ref name="HC wedding"/><ref name=PWeekly/> Brie's mother is Jewish,<ref name=very>{{cite web|url=http://www.jta.org/2013/05/09/arts-entertainment/alison-brie-talks-jewish-mother-drama-on-wtf-with-marc-maron|title=Alison Brie on her very Jewish mother|website=[[Jewish Telegraphic Agency]]|date=May 9, 2013|first=Jana|last=Banin|accessdate=June 1, 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Sam|last=Fragoso|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/sundance-film-festival-alison-brie-nudity|title=At Sundance, Alison Brie Steers the Conversation Back to Nudity|work=Vogue magazine|date=January 27, 2017|accessdate=May 13, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Brendan|last=Morrow|url=https://heavy.com/entertainment/2017/06/alison-brie-family-mother-father-parents-sister-lauren-dave-franco/|title=Alison Brie’s Family: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know|work=[[Heavy.com]]|date=June 23, 2017|accessdate=May 13, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Kaleem|last=Aftab|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/alison-brie-on-sleeping-with-other-people-mad-men-and-being-a-very-serious-actress-a6788606.html|title=Alison Brie on 'Sleeping with Other People', 'Mad Men', and being a very serious actress|work=[[The Independent]]|date=December 28, 2015|accessdate=May 13, 2018}}</ref> while her father has Dutch, English, and Scottish ancestry. While being raised by her divorced parents, she occasionally attended a "[[Christian]]–[[Hindu]] hybrid church" called the [[Self-Realization Fellowship]] with her father. However, her mother "would always make sure we knew we were Jewish".<ref name=very /><ref name=dp30>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=orKphoKU3Ck|title=DP/30 Emmywatch: Community/Mad Men, actor Alison Brie|website=Emmywatch}}</ref><ref name="popmatters">{{cite web|url=http://www.popmatters.com/pm/feature/116229-alison-brie-and-donald-glover-of-community|title=Alison Brie and Donald Glover of 'Community'|date=November 17, 2009|website=PopMatters.com|accessdate=November 17, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091120041134/http://www.popmatters.com/pm/feature/116229-alison-brie-and-donald-glover-of-community|archivedate=November 20, 2009|deadurl=no}}</ref>
Brie began acting onstage at the [[Jewish Community Center]] in [[Southern California]].<ref name=PWeekly /><ref name="slant">{{cite web|last=Andelman|first=Bob|title=From Mad Men's Trudy to Community's Annie, actor Alison Brie is a hit|website=True/Slant|date=November 12, 2009|url=http://trueslant.com/bobandelman/2009/11/12/from-mad-mens-trudy-to-communitys-annie-actor-alison-brie-is-a-hit/|accessdate=November 18, 2009}}</ref> She graduated from the [[California Institute of the Arts]] with a [[bachelor's degree]] in theater in 2005.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lippsisters.com/2008/10/12/exclusive-alison-brie-interview-part-1-and-toto-too|title=Exclusive Alison Brie Interview, part 1|last=Lipp|first=Deborah|date=October 12, 2008|website=Basket of Kisses|accessdate=September 18, 2009}}</ref> She studied for a time at [[Glasgow]]'s [[Royal Scottish Academy of Music and Drama]].<ref name=PWeekly/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RF_OzYINplo|title=Alison Brie on The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson|website=YouTube|date=October 29, 2010|accessdate=September 30, 2009}}</ref> She later worked as a clown at birthday parties and performed in theater in California.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.esquire.com/women/funny-joke-from-a-beautiful-woman/alison-brie-photo-1009|title=Alison Brie: Funny Joke from a Beautiful Woman|last=Price|first=Erik|date=September 11, 2009|website=[[Esquire (magazine)|Esquire]]|accessdate=September 18, 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090915172243/http://www.esquire.com/women/funny-joke-from-a-beautiful-woman/alison-brie-photo-1009|archivedate=September 15, 2009|deadurl=no}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:Alison Brie.jpg|thumb|Brie at the 2009 [[Los Angeles Film Festival]].]]
One of Brie's first television roles was as Nina, a novice [[hairdresser]], on ''[[Hannah Montana]]''. She went on to star in the web series ''[[My Alibi]]'' and was chosen for the role of [[Trudy Campbell]] in ''[[Mad Men]]''. From 2009 to 2015, she portrayed [[Annie Edison]] on the [[NBC]] (and later [[Yahoo! Screen]]) sitcom ''[[Community (TV series)|Community]]''.
In April 2010, Brie co-hosted an episode of ''[[Attack of the Show!]]''<ref>{{cite web|title=Alison Brie on Attack of the Show [2011-04-14]|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0lwSAcXqhwc|website=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=May 7, 2013}}</ref> and appeared in a short segment on ''[[Web Soup]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Web Soup: Alison Brie Laughs at Dead People|url=http://www.bing.com/videos/watch/video/alison-brie-laughs-at-dead-people/17wt3po4l?cpkey=0b188051-60ed-4b7a-a0b4-725002533344%257c%257c%257c%257c|website=Bing|accessdate=May 7, 2013}}</ref> She appeared in the 2010 film ''[[Montana Amazon]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cinematical.com/2008/04/07/casting-bites-part-two-some-brie-and-strik/|title=Casting Bites, Part Two: Some Brie and Strik|last=Bartyzel|first=Monika|date=April 7, 2008|website=Cinematical|accessdate=September 18, 2009}}</ref> Brie made [[Maxim (magazine)|''Maxim'' magazine]]'s 2010 Hot 100 list at number 99<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maxim.com/girls/girls-of-maxim/92660/2010-hot-100.html#2|title=2010 Hot 100|website=Maxim|accessdate=May 26, 2010|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100526173533/http://www.maxim.com/girls/girls-of-maxim/92660/2010-hot-100.html|archivedate=May 26, 2010|deadurl=no}}</ref> and appeared at number 49 in their 2011 list.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maxim.com/amg/GIRLS/Articles/2011+Hot+100 |title=2011 Hot 100 |website=Maxim |accessdate=May 3, 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609204706/http://www.maxim.com/amg/GIRLS/Articles/2011%2BHot%2B100 |archivedate=June 9, 2011 |deadurl=yes }}</ref> She was voted the [[FHM's 100 Sexiest Women (UK)|57th sexiest woman in the world]] by ''[[FHM]]'' readers in 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fhm.com/girls/covergirls/alison-brie|title=Alison Brie|website=FHM}}</ref> She was also voted the 2nd most desirable woman in the world by ''[[Askmen]]'' readers in 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://worldenow.com/2014/02/emilia-clarke-tops-askmens-women-2014-list/ |title=Emilia Clarke Voted Most Desirable Woman |accessdate=March 5, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140306054124/http://worldenow.com/2014/02/emilia-clarke-tops-askmens-women-2014-list/ |archivedate=March 6, 2014 }}</ref>
Brie starred in several major film roles, including [[Sidney Prescott]]'s assistant in the 2011 horror film ''[[Scream 4]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bloody-disgusting.com/news/20770|title='Community' Chick and 'Donnie Darko' Mom Join 'Scream' Mystery|website=[[Bloody Disgusting]]|date=July 1, 2010|accessdate=August 21, 2011|last=Miska|first=Brad}}</ref> and appeared in the 2012 comedy film ''[[The Five-Year Engagement]]''. She voiced Princess Unikitty in ''[[The Lego Movie]]'' (2014), and voiced a character in an episode of the long-running [[adult animation]] series ''[[American Dad!]]'', which aired during their [[American Dad! (season 8)|8th season]].<ref name="variety1">{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2013/tv/news/kim-kardashian-to-play-alien-on-american-dad-1200665746/|title=Kim Kardashian 'American Dad'; Reality Star to Play Alien on Comedy|website=Variety|accessdate=September 25, 2013}}</ref><ref name="insidetv1">{{cite web|last=Hibberd|first=James|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2013/09/24/american-dad-kim-kardashian/|title=Kim Kardashian to play alien on 'American Dad'|website=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=September 25, 2013}}</ref> In 2015, she starred with [[Jason Sudeikis]] in [[Leslye Headland]]'s romantic comedy film ''[[Sleeping with Other People]]'' and played [[Will Ferrell]]'s character's fiancée in ''[[Get Hard]]''.<ref name="Alison">{{cite web|last=Fleming Jr|first=Mike|title='Community's Alison Brie Joins Will Ferrell-Kevin Hart Comedy 'Get Hard'|url=http://deadline.com/2014/03/communitys-alison-brie-joins-will-ferrell-kevin-hart-comedy-get-hard/|accessdate=March 18, 2014|website=Deadline Hollywood|date=March 17, 2014}}</ref> In 2016, Brie starred as Lucy in the romantic comedy film ''[[How to Be Single]]''. In 2017, Brie co-starred in several films, including the historical comedy ''[[The Little Hours]]'', the biographical comedy-drama ''[[The Disaster Artist (film)|The Disaster Artist]]'', and the historical drama ''[[The Post (film)|The Post]]''.
In June 2014, Brie joined the cast of the [[Netflix]] series ''[[BoJack Horseman]]'', which debuted on August 22. Over the first two seasons, she has voiced a variety of characters, including main character Diane Nguyen and recurring character Vincent Adultman.<ref>{{cite web|last=Knight|first=James|title='Mad Men' Alison Brie New Netflix Show Bojack with 'Breaking Bad' Aaron Paul After 'Community' Cancellation [TRAILER]|url=http://www.classicalite.com/articles/8893/20140607/mad-men-alison-brie-new-netflix-show-bojack-breaking-bad.htm|website=Classicalite.com|accessdate=June 17, 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Strecker|first=Erin|title='BoJack Horseman': New Netflix comedy features voices of Will Arnett, Amy Sedaris, more|url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2014/06/04/bojack-horseman-netflix-will-arnett/|website=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|accessdate=June 17, 2014|date=April 6, 2014}}</ref> Brie also appeared on ''[[Lip Sync Battle]]'' and won against [[Will Arnett]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.spike.com/episodes/77pjpt/lip-sync-battle-alison-brie-vs-will-arnett-season-1-ep-117|title=Alison Brie beats Will Arnett on Lip Sync Battle|website=Spike.com}}</ref>
In August 2016, Brie was set to star in the Netflix original comedy series ''[[GLOW (TV series)|GLOW]]'' which was inspired by the 1980s female professional wrestling league [[Gorgeous Ladies of Wrestling]];<ref>{{cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=August 29, 2016|title=Alison Brie To Star In Netflix Comedy Series 'G.L.O.W.' From Jenji Kohan|url=http://deadline.com/2016/08/alison-brie-star-glow-netflix-wrestling-comedy-series-jenji-kohan-1201810007/|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=October 21, 2016}}</ref> the series was released on June 23, 2017. Brie noted that after appearing in ''GLOW'', and receiving critical praise for the role, that she had become more focused on taking meaningful roles.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/alison-brie-talks-finding-meaningful-projects-glow-i-became-very-picky-1071573|title=Alison Brie Talks Finding "Meaningful" Projects: "After 'GLOW,' I Became Very Picky"|date=January 8, 2018|first=Mia|last=Galuppo|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]}}</ref>
==Personal life== Brie began dating actor [[Dave Franco]] in 2012 after meeting him at a 2011 [[Mardi Gras]] party in [[New Orleans]].<ref name="EOnline Engaged">{{cite web|first=Marc|last=Malkin|url=http://www.eonline.com/news/689488/exclusive-alison-brie-and-dave-franco-engaged-see-the-ring-now|title=Exclusive! Alison Brie and Dave Franco Engaged—See the Ring Now|date=August 24, 2015|website=E! Online|accessdate=January 17, 2016}}</ref> On August 25, 2015, it was reported the two were engaged.<ref name="EOnline Engaged" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.people.com/article/dave-franco-alison-brie-engaged|title=Alison Brie and Dave Franco Are Engaged!|first=Char|last=Adams|date=August 25, 2015|website=[[People (magazine)|People]].com|accessdate=January 17, 2016}}</ref> They married on March 13, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.etonline.com/news/212833_dave_franco_and_alison_brie_are_married/|title=Dave Franco and Alison Brie Are Married!|date=March 13, 2017|accessdate=April 19, 2017|website=[[ET Online]]|first=Meredith|last=Kile}}</ref>

Bang!]]'' | Herself | Episode: "Alison Brie Wears a Black Mesh Top & Mini-Skirt" |- | 2014–present | ''[[BoJack Horseman]]'' | Diane Nguyen / Various Characters | Voice role; 48 episodes |- | 2015 | ''[[Lip Sync Battle]]'' | Herself | Episode: "Alison Brie vs. Will Arnett" |- | style="white-space:nowrap;" | 2016–present | ''[[Teachers (2016 TV series)|Teachers]]'' | Lauren Lark | Episode: "Pilot"; also executive producer |- | 2016 | ''[[Doctor Thorne (TV series)|Doctor Thorne]]'' | Martha Dunstable | 3 episodes |- | 2017 | ''[[Dr. Ken]]'' | Herself | Episode: "Ken's Big Audition" |- | 2017–present | ''[[GLOW (TV series)|GLOW]]'' | Ruth Wilder | Main role, 20 episodes |}

|url=http://people.com/tv/golden-globes-2018-best-comedy-actress-rachel-brosnahan/ |date=January 8, 2018 |access-date=January 8, 2018 |journal=[[People (magazine)|People]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal Verge]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last=Otterson |first=Joe |title=''Mrs. Maisel'' Star Rachel Brosnahan Advocates for More Women's Stories During Golden Globes Win |url=https://variety.com/2018/tv/news/rachel-brosnahan-wins-golden-globe-best-actress-comedy-marvelous-mrs-maisel-1202652060/ |date=January 8, 2018 |access-date=January 8, 2018 |journal=[[Variety
